contentBlocks.title: General Requirements
items: A hot water system must be capable of being deactivated when the building or part of a building served by that system is not occupied
Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from exceeding 60°C
Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 50°C
Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 45°C in a healthcare building
Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 40°C in a building that is not a healthcare building
Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 35°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 30°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned or mechanically ventilated

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 25°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated or heated

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 20°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated, heated or cooled

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 15°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated, heated, cooled or provided with hot water

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 10°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated, heated, cooled, provided with hot water or provided with cold water

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 5°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated, heated, cooled, provided with hot water, provided with cold water or provided with any other service

Must have a control system that prevents the temperature of the hot water from falling below 0°C in a building that is not a healthcare building and is not required to be air-conditioned, mechanically ventilated, heated, cooled, provided with hot water, provided with cold water, provided with any other service or provided with any other requirement

contentBlocks.title: Time Switches Requirements
items: A time switch must be provided to control a hot water system of more than 2 kWr
A time switch must be provided to control a heater of more than 1 kW used for hot water
The time switch must be capable of switching electric power on and off at variable pre-programmed times and on variable pre-programmed days

contentBlocks.title: Time Switch Exemptions
items: A hot water system that serves only one sole-occupancy unit in a Class 2, 3 or 9c building
A hot water system that serves a Class 4 part of a building
A building where hot water is needed for 24 hour continuous use

contentBlocks.title: Boiler Requirements
items: A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 90% at 100% of rated output
A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 85% at 30% of rated output
A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 80% at 10% of rated output

contentBlocks.title: Heat Pump Requirements
items: A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 3.5 at 100% of rated output
A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 3.0 at 50% of rated output
A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 2.5 at 25% of rated output

contentBlocks.title: Exemptions
items: A hot water system that serves only one sole-occupancy unit in a Class 2, 3 or 9c building
A hot water system that serves a Class 4 part of a building
A building where hot water is needed for 24 hour continuous use
A building that is not required to be provided with hot water
A building that is required to be provided with hot water but is not required to be air-conditioned
A building that is required to be provided with hot water and is required to be air-conditioned but is not required to be mechanically ventilated
A building that is required to be provided with hot water, is required to be air-conditioned and is required to be mechanically ventilated but is not required to have an outdoor air economy cycle
